review: It installs and works fine.  However, I'm a little disappointed in the movie selection from Amazon Prime.  I thought with the 40,000 movies you advertise most of the good shows/movies from a few years back would be free.  That is not the case.  Not many James Bond titles, or Dean Martin & Jerry Lewis, no Mr. Roberts and so on.Haven't tried TV shows yet.  Wonder if I can get all the old Saturday night Live shows free?
author: H. Eugene Polhemus Jr.

review: First off, Amazon voice works really well!I was hyped about the Amazon Fire TV because I heard great things about it.The problem that I have this this product is that there isn't enough content.There are a lot of shows/series on Amazon Prime; however, many of them aren't up-to-date.The HBO GO, showtime, ect... content are paid content, meaning that it isn't really a perk that you get from buying Amazon Fire TV.I understand that there are a lot of movies in the world, but about 9/10 movies that I search for have to be purchased. What good is my Amazon Prime?Lastly, I was excited about this unit because it is an all-in-one entertainment piece.....The games for sale on the Fire TV are VERY cheap in comparison to PC or gaming consoles.The problem with this is that the device only has 8GB of storage... Since some of the games take 2GB of space or more... I can logically store NO more than 4 of these games on my device. What is worse is that there is currently NO way to expand your hard drive, for the the USB plug-in in the back CANNOT be used for storage.I'm NOT trying to bash on Amazon because I love the company!However, it would be nice if they put more effort into making making this product better.
author: Jeroen
